event_registry_properties.name: title
event_registry_properties.item: Upgrading Solaris systems with non-global zones installed
event_registry_properties.name: description
event_registry_properties.item: The Solaris system or boot environment that is being upgraded has non-global zones installed. The current version of Live Upgrade cannot upgrade a boot environment that has non-global zones installed.
event_registry_properties.name: response
event_registry_properties.item: The upgrade procedure has been terminated.
event_registry_properties.name: impact
event_registry_properties.item: The Solaris system or boot environment is not upgraded.
event_registry_properties.name: action
event_registry_properties.item: Evaluate each of the choices below and select the one that is best for your needs. Contact Sun for support.
event_registry_properties.name: details
event_registry_properties.item:
• Use the standard Solaris interactive installation program to upgrade your system. See Chapter 3, Solaris Installation and Upgrade (Planning) in Solaris 10 Installation Guide: Solaris Live Upgrade and Upgrade Planning , and Solaris 10 Installation Guide: Basic Installations . Note that the media used for the installation must be either a DVD or a network installation image created from a DVD.

  • Use the custom JumpStart installation program to upgrade your system. See Chapter 3, Solaris Installation and Upgrade (Planning) in Solaris 10 Installation Guide: Solaris Live Upgrade and Upgrade Planning , and Chapter 11, Custom JumpStart (Reference) in Solaris 10 Installation Guide: Custom JumpStart and Advanced Installations . Note that the media used for the installation must be either a DVD or a network installation image created from a DVD.

  • Save all application data, uninstall all of the existing non-global zones, and use any installation method to upgrade your system. All of the non-global zones and their applications must then be reinstalled. This option is basically an upgrade of the global zone using any installation method, including Live Upgrade, and an initial install of all the non-global zones.

  • Choose to wait for Solaris Live Upgrade to be supported on your system configuration in a future release. With this option, specific patches for issues of concern can still be installed at this time.
